verses.verse: A Psalm of Asaph. Surely God <WH430> is good <WH2896> to Israel <WH3478>, Even to such as are pure <WH1249> in heart <WH3824>.
But as for me <WH7272>, my feet were almost <WH4592> gone <WH5186>; My steps <WH838> had well nigh <WH369> slipped <WH8210>.
For I was envious <WH7065> at the arrogant <WH1984>, When I saw <WH7200> the prosperity <WH7965> of the wicked <WH7563>.
For there are no pangs <WH2784> in their death <WH4194>; But their strength <WH193> is firm <WH1277>.
They are not in trouble <WH5999> as other men <WH582>; Neither are they plagued <WH5060> like <WH5973> other men <WH120>.
Therefore pride <WH1346> is as a chain <WH6059> about their neck <WH2555>; Violence covereth <WH5848> them as a garment <WH7897>.
Their eyes <WH5869> stand out <WH3318> with fatness <WH2459>: They have more <WH5674> than heart <WH3824> could wish <WH4906>.
They scoff <WH4167>, and in wickedness <WH7451> utter <WH1696> oppression <WH6233>: They speak <WH1696> loftily <WH4791>.
They have set <WH8371> their mouth <WH6310> in the heavens <WH8064>, And their tongue <WH3956> walketh <WH1980> through the earth <WH776>.
Therefore his people <WH5971> return <WH7725> hither <WH1988>: And waters <WH4325> of a full <WH4392> cup are drained by them <WH4680>.
And they say <WH559>, How doth God <WH410> know <WH3045>? And is there <WH3426> knowledge <WH1844> in the Most High <WH5945>?
Behold <WH7563>, these are the wicked; And <WH5769>, being alway at ease <WH7961>, they increase <WH7685> in riches <WH2428>.
Surely in vain <WH7385> have I cleansed <WH2135> my heart <WH3824>, And washed <WH7364> my hands <WH3709> in innocency <WH5356>;
For all the day <WH3117> long have I been plagued <WH5060>, And chastened <WH8433> every morning <WH1242>.
If I had said <WH559>, I will speak <WH559> thus <WH3644>; Behold <WH898>, I had dealt treacherously with the generation <WH1755> of thy children <WH1121>.
When I thought <WH2803> how I might know <WH3045> this <WH5999>, It was too painful for me <WH5869>;
Until I went <WH935> into the sanctuary <WH4720> of God <WH410>, And considered <WH995> their latter end <WH319>.
Surely thou settest <WH7896> them in slippery places <WH2513>: Thou castest them down <WH5307> to destruction <WH4876>.
How are they become a desolation <WH8047> in a moment <WH7281>! They are utterly <WH5486> consumed <WH8552> with terrors <WH1091>.
As a dream <WH2472> when one awaketh <WH6974>, So <WH136>, O Lord, when thou awakest <WH5782>, thou wilt despise <WH959> their image <WH6754>.
For my soul <WH3824> was grieved <WH2556>, And I was pricked <WH8150> in my heart <WH3629>:
So brutish <WH1198> was I <WH3045>, and ignorant; I was as a beast before thee <WH929>.
Nevertheless I am continually <WH8548> with thee <WH270>: Thou hast holden my right <WH3225> hand <WH3027>.
Thou wilt guide <WH5148> me with thy counsel <WH6098>, And afterward <WH310> receive <WH3947> me to glory <WH3519>.
Whom have I in heaven <WH8064> but thee <WH776>? And there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee <WH2654>.
My flesh <WH7607> and my heart <WH3824> faileth <WH3615>; But God <WH430> is the strength <WH6697> of my heart <WH3824> and my portion <WH2506> for ever <WH5769>.
For <WH7369>, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish <WH6>: Thou hast destroyed <WH6789> all them that play the harlot <WH2181>, departing from thee.

But <WH589> it is good <WH2896> for me to draw near <WH7132> unto God <WH430>: I have made <WH7896> the Lord <WH136> Jehovah <WH136> my refuge <WH4268>, That I may tell <WH5608> of all thy works <WH4399>.
